verses.verse: Now it happened on the third <S%H7992><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> that Esther <S%H635><s%> put on <S%H3847><s%> her royal <S%H4438><s%> clothing, <S%H5975><s%> and stood in the inner <S%H6442><s%> court <S%H2691><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%>'s house, <S%H1004><s%> next to <S%H5227><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%>'s house. <S%H1004><s%> The king <S%H4428><s%> sat <S%H3427><s%> on his royal <S%H4438><s%> throne <S%H3678><s%> in the royal <S%H4438><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> next to <S%H5227><s%> the entrance <S%H6607><s%> of the house. <S%H1004><s%>

When the king <S%H4428><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> Esther <S%H635><s%> the queen <S%H4436><s%> standing <S%H5975><s%> in the court, <S%H2691><s%> she obtained <S%H5375><s%> favor <S%H2580><s%> in his sight; <S%H5869><s%> and the king <S%H4428><s%> held out <S%H3447><s%> to Esther <S%H635><s%> the golden <S%H2091><s%> scepter <S%H8275><s%> that was in his hand. <S%H3027><s%> So Esther <S%H635><s%> came near, <S%H7126><s%> and touched <S%H5060><s%> the top <S%H7218><s%> of the scepter. <S%H8275><s%>

Then the king <S%H4428><s%> asked <S%H559><s%> her, <S%H4436><s%> "What would you like, queen Esther? <S%H635><s%> What is your request? <S%H1246><s%> It shall be given <S%H5414><s%> you even to the half <S%H2677><s%> of the kingdom. <S%H4438><s%>"

Esther <S%H635><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "If it seems good <S%H2895><s%> to the king, <S%H4428><s%> let the king <S%H4428><s%> and Haman <S%H2001><s%> come <S%H935><s%> today <S%H3117><s%> to the banquet <S%H4960><s%> that I have prepared for him. <S%H6213><s%>"

Then the king <S%H4428><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Bring Haman <S%H2001><s%> quickly, <S%H4116><s%> so that it may be done <S%H6213><s%> as Esther <S%H635><s%> has said. <S%H1697><s%>" So the king <S%H4428><s%> and Haman <S%H2001><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to the banquet <S%H4960><s%> that Esther <S%H635><s%> had prepared. <S%H6213><s%>

The king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Esther <S%H635><s%> at the banquet <S%H4960><s%> of wine, <S%H3196><s%> "What is your petition? <S%H7596><s%> It shall be granted <S%H5414><s%> you. <S%H1246><s%> What is your request? Even to the half <S%H2677><s%> of the kingdom <S%H4438><s%> it shall be performed. <S%H6213><s%>"
Then Esther <S%H635><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "My petition <S%H7596><s%> and my request is this. <S%H1246><s%>

If I have found <S%H4672><s%> favor <S%H2580><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of the king, <S%H4428><s%> and if it please <S%H2895><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> to grant <S%H5414><s%> my petition <S%H7596><s%> and to perform <S%H6213><s%> my request, <S%H1246><s%> let the king <S%H4428><s%> and Haman <S%H2001><s%> come <S%H935><s%> to the banquet <S%H4960><s%> that I will prepare <S%H6213><s%> for them, <S%H6213><s%> and I will do tomorrow <S%H4279><s%> as the king <S%H4428><s%> has said. <S%H1697><s%>"

Then Haman <S%H2001><s%> went <S%H3318><s%> out <S%H3318><s%> that day <S%H3117><s%> joyful <S%H8056><s%> and glad <S%H2896><s%> of heart, <S%H3820><s%> but when Haman <S%H2001><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> Mordecai <S%H4782><s%> in the king <S%H4428><s%>'s gate, <S%H8179><s%> that he didn't <S%H6965><s%> stand up nor move <S%H2111><s%> for him, <S%H2001><s%> he was filled <S%H4390><s%> with wrath <S%H2534><s%> against Mordecai. <S%H4782><s%>

Nevertheless Haman <S%H2001><s%> restrained <S%H662><s%> himself, <S%H935><s%> and went home. <S%H1004><s%> There, <S%H7971><s%> he sent and called <S%H935><s%> for his friends <S%H157><s%> and Zeresh <S%H2238><s%> his wife. <S%H802><s%>

Haman <S%H2001><s%> recounted <S%H5608><s%> to them the glory <S%H3519><s%> of his riches, <S%H6239><s%> the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of his children, <S%H1121><s%> all the things in which the king <S%H4428><s%> had promoted <S%H1431><s%> him, <S%H5375><s%> and how he had advanced him above the princes <S%H8269><s%> and servants <S%H5650><s%> of the king. <S%H4428><s%>

Haman <S%H2001><s%> also said, <S%H559><s%> "Yes, <S%H635><s%> Esther the queen <S%H4436><s%> let no man come in <S%H935><s%> with the king <S%H4428><s%> to the banquet <S%H4960><s%> that she had prepared <S%H6213><s%> but myself; <S%H4279><s%> and tomorrow I am also invited <S%H7121><s%> by her together with the king. <S%H4428><s%>

Yet all this avails <S%H7737><s%> me nothing, <S%H6256><s%> so long as I see <S%H7200><s%> Mordecai <S%H4782><s%> the Jew <S%H3064><s%> sitting <S%H3427><s%> at the king <S%H4428><s%>'s gate. <S%H8179><s%>"

Then Zeresh <S%H2238><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%> and all his friends <S%H157><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H6086><s%> "Let a gallows be made <S%H6213><s%> fifty <S%H2572><s%> cubits <S%H520><s%> high, <S%H1364><s%> and in the morning <S%H1242><s%> speak <S%H559><s%> to the king <S%H4428><s%> about hanging <S%H8518><s%> Mordecai <S%H4782><s%> on it. <S%H935><s%> Then go in merrily <S%H8056><s%> with the king <S%H4428><s%> to the banquet. <S%H4960><s%>" This <S%H1697><s%> pleased <S%H3190><s%> Haman, <S%H2001><s%> so he had <S%H6213><s%> the gallows <S%H6086><s%> made. <S%H6213><s%>
